Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed jar, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink with image beneath.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394289) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394289)
